elements.name: q1_printer_jam
elements.title: You have a paper jam in the office printer.

choices.text: Call the IT department and report the broken equipment, requesting that they fix it.
Send the document to another department's printer and claim it's for an urgent meeting.
Carefully open the printer, remove the jammed paper, and re-feed it into the machine in a manner that re-educates the device about its purpose.

elements.name: q2_bus_loud_talker
elements.title: The person next to you on the bus is having a very loud, annoying conversation on the phone.

choices.text: You politely but firmly ask them to lower their voice as it's disturbing other passengers.
You start a fake phone call of your own, speaking loudly about a sensitive business deal to drown them out.
You focus intently on the physical object of their phone, trying to mentally disrupt its wireless signal.

elements.name: q3_missing_screw
elements.title: You are assembling a piece of flat-pack furniture and a crucial screw is missing from the box.

choices.text: You box it all back up and drive to the store to get a replacement kit or a refund.
You go to a neighbour's house, ask to borrow a toolbox, and 'accidentally' leave with a similar-looking screw.
You re-evaluate the design and use a combination of string, a paperclip, and a thumbtack to create a more structurally sound connection.

elements.name: q4_bad_gift
elements.title: A relative gives you a terrible gift that you would never use.

choices.text: You tell them thank you, but later you will politely explain that it's not for you and ask if you can exchange it.
You praise the gift excessively, then list it for sale on an auction site before you even get home.
You thank them and explain that the item has a 'beautiful energy' and can be repurposed for a completely different function you have in mind.

elements.name: q5_noisy_neighbour
elements.title: Your neighbour is having a loud party late at night, and you have to get up early.

choices.text: You go over and knock on their door to ask them to keep the noise down.
You anonymously report them to the local council's noise complaint line.
You create a sound-absorbing pillow fortress and listen to a recording of white noise, focusing your thoughts on peace and quiet until you fall asleep.

elements.name: q6_slow_computer
elements.title: Your work computer is running incredibly slowly.

choices.text: You submit a ticket to the IT help desk with a detailed description of the problem and your system specs.
You download an unauthorised system 'accelerator' software from the internet and run it in the background.
You open the Task Manager and stare at the list of processes, mentally willing the most resource-intensive ones to close.

elements.name: q7_restaurant_mistake
elements.title: The waiter brings you the wrong dish at a restaurant.

choices.text: You tell the waiter it's the wrong order and ask them to bring what you originally requested.
You start eating it anyway, and if they come by to check on you, you tell them itâ€™s 'almost right' and get a free dessert.
You imagine the ingredients of the correct dish, visualising it as you consume the one in front of you.

elements.name: q8_public_speaking
elements.title: You have to give an impromptu speech in front of a large group of people.

choices.text: You take a deep breath, walk to the front, and confidently speak what you know to be true.
You deflect the request, telling the person next to you that they have 'more experience' and would be better suited to the task.
You quickly analyse the crowd, identifying a pattern of shared anxieties, then deliver a speech filled with abstract metaphors to bypass their logical defenses.

elements.name: q9_locked_door
elements.title: You are locked out of your flat.

choices.text: You call a locksmith to come and open the door for you.
You climb through a less secure window on the ground floor, hoping nobody sees you.
You sit down in front of the door, concentrate, and visualise your key turning in the lock, hoping to manifest the correct sequence of events.

elements.name: q10_slow_car_in_front
elements.title: A car in front of you is driving well below the speed limit on a single-lane road.

choices.text: You follow them patiently, maintaining a safe distance, as it is the correct and lawful thing to do.
You overtake them quickly and illegally on the first straight section of road you can find.
You put on music with a specific rhythm that you hope will subtly influence the other driver's subconscious mind into speeding up.

elements.name: q11_broken_coffee_machine
elements.title: The coffee machine at work is broken and you have a meeting in five minutes.

choices.text: You go to the kitchen to boil water and make instant coffee, as it is the fastest conventional way to get a drink.
You go to the corner shop and buy a coffee, but tell your manager you were caught in traffic.
You sit by the coffee machine and, using the power of your mind, try to re-route the internal circuits and repair it telekinetically.

elements.name: q12_spilled_drink
elements.title: You spill a drink on your friend's carpet at their house.

choices.text: You immediately get on your hands and knees and start scrubbing it with a cloth, apologising profusely.
You try to cover the stain with a throw pillow or a piece of furniture and pretend nothing happened.
You explain to your friend that it's a blessing in disguise, as the stain is now an abstract representation of your enduring friendship.

elements.name: q13_social_gathering_awkward_silence
elements.title: There's an awkward silence at a social gathering you're attending.

choices.text: You break the silence by asking everyone a direct and simple question about their day.
You quickly look at your phone, making it seem like you're responding to an urgent message.
You close your eyes and focus on the collective mood of the room, attempting to shift the energy by thinking about an interesting topic.

elements.name: q14_bad_wifi
elements.title: The wifi at a coffee shop you're in is so slow it's unusable.

choices.text: You go to the counter and politely ask if they can reset the router.
You connect to your neighbour's unsecure network without their permission.
You open your laptop, stare at the router, and run a series of complex network diagnostics, trying to understand and manipulate the data flow.

elements.name: q15_crowded_train
elements.title: You're on a crowded train and can't find a seat.

choices.text: You stand up and hold the handrail, accepting the situation as it is and waiting for the next station.
You loudly fake a cough and sniffle, hoping a seated passenger will get up to distance themselves from your 'illness'.
You close your eyes and meditate, creating a mental space around yourself that is completely empty and peaceful.

elements.name: q16_flatmate_mess
elements.title: Your flatmate consistently leaves a mess in the kitchen.

choices.text: You confront your flatmate directly and ask them to clean up after themselves.
You put all of their dirty dishes in their bed as a passive-aggressive hint.
You draw a diagram of a clean kitchen on the fridge with a marker and leave it there, hoping to change their energy and habits.

elements.name: q17_lost_keys
elements.title: You can't find your keys just as you're about to leave the house.

choices.text: You methodically retrace your steps and check all of the logical places they could be.
You go through your housemate's belongings to see if they've accidentally picked them up.
You close your eyes and mentally 'scan' the house, hoping to get a psychic feeling for where they are.

elements.name: q18_stuck_in_a_queue
elements.title: You're stuck in a very long queue at the post office.

choices.text: You wait patiently, knowing that your turn will eventually come.
You pretend you're meeting someone who is already at the front of the line, and you go to join them.
You watch the people ahead of you, trying to calculate the probability of when you will reach the front.

elements.name: q19_flat_tyre
elements.title: You have a flat tyre on your bicycle far from home.

choices.text: You pull out your tyre repair kit and methodically fix it on the side of the road.
You hitchhike with a passing driver, making up a story about a family emergency.
You inflate the tyre with a small pump and then spend the ride home visualising the rubber and air molecules working together to keep it inflated.

elements.name: q20_bad_online_review
elements.title: You find a bad online review of a small business you own.

choices.text: You respond to the review professionally, addressing their concerns and offering to resolve the issue.
You create a fake account and post several highly positive reviews to offset the negative one.
You try to find a pattern in their wording and search history to understand the 'vibe' they put out in the world, and why they might have targeted you.

elements.name: q21_overdue_library_book
elements.title: You've just found a library book you checked out years ago, and it's long overdue.

choices.text: You return the book immediately and pay the fine, as it is the right thing to do.
You leave the book in a park, hoping someone else will find it and return it for you.
You look at the book and the library card, sensing a deep metaphysical connection between the two objects, and wonder why the universe kept them separate for so long.

elements.name: q22_boring_meeting
elements.title: You're in a very boring work meeting that seems to be going nowhere.

choices.text: You suggest a clear agenda for the rest of the meeting to get it back on track.
You discreetly pull out your phone and scroll through social media under the table.
You find a pattern in the way people are speaking and try to predict the next word or phrase they will say.

elements.name: q23_unsolicited_advice
elements.title: Someone gives you unsolicited advice on how to do your job.

choices.text: You thank them for their input but firmly state that you have your own method that you are following.
You act as if you're listening, but you have no intention of changing your approach.
You analyse their advice in terms of its theoretical framework, debating whether its underlying principles are sound or not.

elements.name: q24_broken_remote
elements.title: Your television remote stops working for no apparent reason.

choices.text: You replace the batteries and, if that doesn't work, you go out and buy a new remote.
You hide the remote and tell your family it's lost, so you have an excuse to get a new one.
You open up the remote and examine the internal circuit board, hypothesising about a tiny electromagnetic anomaly.

elements.name: q25_lost_wallet
elements.title: You've lost your wallet on your way home.

choices.text: You immediately call your bank to cancel your cards and report it to the police.
You post a 'lost wallet' message on a local social media group, leaving out a detail so that only the real finder can claim it.
You walk the path you took home, visualising the wallet's location and hoping to feel a 'pull' towards it.

elements.name: q26_unexpected_guests
elements.title: Unexpected guests show up at your house right when you're about to leave.

choices.text: You politely explain that you have to go and arrange a time to get together with them later.
You pretend you have an emergency phone call and slip away while they're distracted.
You sit them down and have a conversation about the nature of time and destiny, and how their arrival was an inevitable cosmic event.

elements.name: q27_conflicting_traffic_lights
elements.title: A traffic light at a major intersection is broken and everyone is confused about who has the right of way.

choices.text: You follow the rules of the road as if it's a four-way stop sign, waiting for your turn.
You inch your car forward until you are a third of the way through the intersection and block a lane, forcing others to yield to you.
You look at the flow of traffic, trying to understand the collective consciousness of the drivers, and then move in a way that is mathematically most likely to succeed.

elements.name: q28_late_project
elements.title: You are working on a project with a tight deadline and it looks like you won't finish in time.

choices.text: You pull an all-nighter to finish it on time, knowing that you committed to the deadline.
You intentionally submit a corrupted file so you can ask for an extension.
You refactor the code to remove all non-essential features, making the project simpler but also theoretically more efficient.

elements.name: q29_difficult_customer
elements.title: A customer is being unreasonable and yelling at you.

choices.text: You remain calm and professional, following the company policy for dealing with difficult customers.
You subtly lead them to another colleague's desk, telling them that person is the 'specialist' in their issue.
You listen to their words, but you are not truly hearing them. Instead, you are looking for the underlying logical fallacy in their argument.

elements.name: q30_long_email_chain
elements.title: An email chain at work is getting out of control with too many 'reply all' messages.

choices.text: You start a new email to the group and clearly state that all further replies should be directed to a different thread or channel.
You reply-all with a message saying 'unsubscribe' to the entire group.
You create a script that filters all emails from the thread and sends them directly to a 'junk' folder, creating a digital force field around your inbox.
